snippet: With Democratic leaders warning of lasting political discord, Michigan’s Republican-led Legislature was on the verge of approving new limits to unions.
abstract: Michigan's Republican-led Legislature is on verge of approving new limits to unions, as Democratic leaders warn of lasting political discord; legislation would bar workers from being required to pay union fees as condition of employment, even as thousands of union members plan to protest at state Capitol; Pres Obama, visiting Detroit,  has denounced notion.

byline.contributor: Mark Landler contributed reporting from Redford, Mich.

lead_paragraph: With Democratic leaders warning of lasting political discord, Michigan’s Republican-led Legislature was on the verge of approving new limits to unions.

headline.seo: Michigan Divided Over Right to Work
headline.main: Michigan Labor Fight Cleaves a Union Bulwark
headline.print_headline: Michigan Fight Cleaves Labor Stronghold as Limits on Unions Near Passage
